Fittingly for veterans of the arena rock ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‹Å“70s, FoghatÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s blues are heavily steeped in the British InvasionÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢s version of the blues -- theyÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â€žÂ¢re long on amplification and extended jams, as should be expected for a band who is an outgrowth of Savoy Brown -- but their roots dig deeper, as evidenced by two good cuts with Eddie Kirkland at the end of the record.
